kizuna_history_c_02: The cursed treasures... The four Pokémon of ruin...[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_c_04:
And I stumbled upon the truth in the newspaper,
of all places! Hah! In an interview piece with a\r
carpenter, no less![VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_c_05:
The Pokémon wielders apparently used sacred
stakes to seal these treasures of ruin in shrines.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_c_06:
There is a separate shrine for each of the four
Pokémon, and eight stakes driven into the ground\r
near each shrine keep the power of ruin at bay.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_c_07:
In other words, if all of the stakes for a given
shrine were to be removed...[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_c_08: it would release the Pokémon held inside![VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_c_09:
Don’t you think it would be nice to free those
Pokémon from the confines of their tiny little\r
shrines, [VAR TRNAME(0000)]?[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_c_10:
Heh. A kind soul, I see. You are proving
truly useful![VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_c_11:
That’s surprisingly heartless of you! Come now—
do it for the Pokémon![VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_c_12:
According to a descendant of the Pokémon
wielders in the story, you must have a bond with\r
Pokémon in order to remove the stakes.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_c_13:
I’m sure someone as Pokémon savvy as yourself
would have no trouble at all with that.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_c_14:
You can choose for yourself whether to believe
me or not, but I will mark the locations of these\r
shrines on your map.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_c_15:
I’d rather go myself, of course, but skipping out
on my classes to go adventuring seems to have\r
made the director a little suspicious of me...[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_c_16:
Heh. You can think of it as part of your Treasure
Hunt. Treasures of ruin are still treasures, after all.\c
I hope you will investigate these shrines if you are
at all inclined to do so.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_c_system_01: You feel trusted by Ms. Raifort!
